meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dim.
meanings.sent1: The dimnesses of the room made it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The dimnesses of the stars in the night sky created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The dimnesses of the light bulb made it look like a tiny glowing moon.
meanings.sent4: In the dimnesses of his memory, he struggled to recall the exact details.
meanings.sent5: The dimnesses of the forest at night were both eerie and enchanting.

meanings.sent1: The dimnesses of the old painting made it hard to make out the details.
meanings.sent2: The dimnesses of the fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The dimnesses of her glasses made her mistake a cat for a hat.
meanings.sent4: Through the dimnesses of doubt, she found clarity in her decision.
meanings.sent5: The dimnesses of the room added a sense of mystery to the atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The dimnesses of the alley made it a perfect spot for hiding.
meanings.sent2: The dimnesses of the dream left him feeling disoriented upon waking.
meanings.sent3: The dimnesses of the riddle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: In the dimnesses of the evening, shadows danced on the walls.
meanings.sent5: The dimnesses of the cave concealed its true beauty until they lit a torch.
